title: Biden again demands action after Texas mall mass shooting
description: The US leader called on Congress to ban assault weapons after latest mass shooting, which left nine dead.

title: Russia’s Wagner Group says more arms promised for Bakhmut battle
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin says the group has been promised as much ammunition and weaponry as needed to carry on the offence.

title: Sudan residents describe raids, evictions by RSF soldiers
description: The RSF has reportedly embedded itself in residential areas by turning flats and even hospitals into military outposts.

title: Bangladesh’s water crisis and the problem of a ‘green’ solution
description: The negative impact of a water project in the city of Khulna should be a cautionary tale for policymakers.

title: Fighting rages in Sudan as mediators seek end to conflict
description: Envoys from warring parties are in Saudi Arabia for talks that mediators hope will bring an end to the conflict.

title: DR Congo floods death toll surpasses 200
description: Authorities say 287 killed and 167 others missing after heavy rains caused floods in South Kivu province.

title: Canada’s Alberta announces state of emergency over wildfires
description: Almost all of Alberta and much of neighbouring Saskatchewan province face extreme fire risks.

title: What has spurred ethnic violence in India’s Manipur?
description: Tribal groups are protesting the prospect of Manipur's majority Meitei community being recognised as "Scheduled Tribe".

title: Iraq court issues death sentence to al-Hashimi’s killer
description: A police officer involved in the murder of the prominent academic and security expert has been sentenced to death.

title: Photos: Hundreds commemorate Shireen Abu Akleh in memorial mass
description: Nearly a year has passed since the veteran Al Jazeera journalist was shot dead by an Israeli soldier on May 11.

title: China, Pakistan and Afghanistan FMs hold talks in Islamabad
description: Foreign ministers from all three nations promise to pursue trilateral cooperation efforts as political ties deepen.

title: What’s behind the recent collapses in the global banking sector?
description: First Republic is the latest US bank to fail as fears persist about the industry's stability.

title: Israel hands over Jordanian lawmaker accused of arms smuggling
description: Imad al-Adwan was held at an Israeli-controlled border crossing for allegedly smuggling more than 200 guns in his car.

title: Photos: The bread delivery runs in Ukraine’s war-torn Donbas
description: The Siversk town hall humanitarian centre gets about 2,500 loaves of bread twice a week.

title: Pakistani man lynched over alleged blasphemy remarks during rally
description: A Muslim cleric killed after his speech at an opposition party's rally in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa was deemed blasphemous.

title: Arab League agrees to bring Syria back into its fold
description: Arab states are normalising ties with Syria, working towards an 'Arab-led political path' to solve the Syrian crisis.

title: ‘Normalisation of violence’: What led to Serbia mass shootings?
description: Violence is ubiquitous in society and major reforms are needed to prevent mass shootings, psychologists say.

title: Sterling beats Cejudo to retain UFC bantamweight title
description: Former two-division champion Henry Cejudo, returning to the UFC after a three-year absence, lost by split decision.

title: ‘Chilling effect’: Israel’s ongoing surveillance of Palestinians
description: Palestinians say Israel's newly exposed facial recognition programme Red Wolf is another way to entrench the occupation.

title: Alvarez beats Ryder to retain super middleweight crown
description: Canelo Alvarez wins the super middleweight world title in his first fight in his native Mexico in 12 years.

title: Sudan fighting in its 23rd day: A list of key events
description: Fighting continues as warring sides begin pre-negotiation talks with Saudi Arabia and the US as mediators.

title: Japan’s Kishida visits S Korea to boost ties amid N Korea threat
description: Prime Minister Fumio Kishida's visit marks the first by a Japanese leader to Seoul in 12 years.

title: Multiple explosions rock Russian-annexed Crimea: Reports
description: Pro-Moscow official says Ukraine launched more than 10 drones on Crimean peninsula, including three on Sevastopol port.

title: Who is Zakhar Prilepin, target of car bomb in Russia?
description: Novelist and politician has been sanctioned by European nations for his ardent support of Russia's war in Ukraine.

title: Nine people shot, wounded at mall in Allen, Texas; gunman dead
description: Police in US confirm fatalities, but say they are not able to confirm how many people died in Allen, a Dallas suburb.
